citation.article-title: Helcococcus sueciensis sp. nov., isolated from a human wound
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Helcococcus sueciensis sp. nov.
Helcococcus sueciensis (su.e.ci.en′sis. N.L. masc. adj. sueciensis from Sweden, the country in which the organism was isolated).
Cells are Gram-positive and coccoid and occur singly, in pairs or in short chains.
Cells are non-acid-fast, non-spore-forming and non-motile.
Pinpoint, grey, non-haemolytic colonies form after 48 h anaerobic incubation on fastidious anaerobe agar with 5 % (v/v) horse blood.
Catalase-negative and facultatively anaerobic, but grows best under anaerobic conditions.
End products of glucose metabolism are acetic and lactic acids.
In conventional tests, acid is produced from glucose, lactose, maltose, mannose (weakly), sorbitol and starch (weakly).
Acid is not formed from cellobiose, sucrose or xylose.

In commercial API systems, acid is produced from glucose, maltose, lactose and trehalose, but not from d-arabitol, l-arabinose, cyclodextrin, glycogen, mannitol, mannose, melibiose, melezitose, methyl β-d-glucopyranoside, pullulan, raffinose, d-ribose, sorbitol, sucrose or tagatose.

Activity is detected for alkaline phosphatase, alanine arylamidase, arginine arylamidase, β-galactosidase, glycine arylamidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, serine arylamidase and tyrosine arylamidase.

Activity is not detected for α-arabinosidase, α-fucosidase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, glutamic acid decarboxylase, β-glucuronidase, glycyl tryptophan arylamidase, proline arylamidase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, β-mannosidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase or urease.
Hippurate is not hydrolysed and indole is not produced.
G+C content of the DNA is 29·5 mol%.
